meanings.definition: Covered with or consisting of small grains or granules.
meanings.sent1: The bread had a grumose crust that crunched with each bite.
meanings.sent2: The sand on the beach felt grumose under my feet.
meanings.sent3: The grumose sugar on the donut made it look like a tiny mountain range.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a grumose quality, rough like sandpaper.
meanings.sent5: The grumose texture of the painting added depth to the artwork.

meanings.definition: Having a rough or lumpy texture.
meanings.sent1: The old tree bark was grumose to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The grumose surface of the rock made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent3: The grumose blanket felt cozy against her skin.
meanings.sent4: His grumose hands showed years of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The grumose road rattled the car as we drove over it.
